seg.seg: ... at the occasion of Maitreya's feast ... they will make a speech, they will compose poems [kāvya]. ...

they will recite [lit. say] Maitreya’s ordination speech, they will compose [lit. make] kāvyas … noble … they will turn (?) noble Maitreya from the beginning in the direction of the three jewels … of Maitreya … they praise [his] royal ordination; or who accordingly [lit. thereupon] … they will say … with … speech and reverence they will praise and honour Maitreya; they will certainly express [lit. do] their approval all together.
... noble ... beginning with the noble Maitreya they will behave correctly, according to the three jewels.
... of Maitreya ... they praise the consecration of Maitreya as successor [lit. son-king]. And, following that, which Tuṣita-(gods) ...
The noble (people) will say praises to the Maitreya as a consecration speech, they will approve they will praise, they will express approbation. Completely, certainly, ...
(When 17.6 million years) pass and (he) (= Maitreya) arises as Buddha in the world, [then] the beings will come (together) with this time. ... (they will behave) with good thinking
(When 17.6 million years) pass and (he) (= Maitreya) arises as Buddha on the earth, [then] the beings will come (together) with this time. (cf 476)
(Wenn 176 Millionen Jahre) vergangen sind [wtl. vergehen], wird er [scil. Maitreya] sich in der Welt als Buddha erheben, [und] die Wesen werden mit dieser Zeit (zusammen)kommen.
(When 176 million years) have passed [lit. are passing], he [i.e. Maitreya] will arise as a Buddha in the world, [and] the beings will come together with this time.

for the humans. Some will hear Maitreya’s law, be redeemed from sorrow [and] reach the prophecy of Buddhahood. Therefore, effort should be made constantly by a conscious person (in order to pay homage to the virtues) of Maitreya.
Some will hear Maitreya’s law, be redeemed from sorrow [and] reach the prophecy of the Buddha rank.
|| Sātāgiri says: "Well spoken, o brother! Therefore, here, for the feast of the ordination of Maitreya, (all sorts of gods) of the whole world (have gathered)."
Pūrṇaka says: "Some of these gods, having descended from heaven, go to Dakṣiṇāpatha, some go to the Pāṣānaka mountain." || Sātāgiri (says:)
(Now) the sarvapāṣaṇḍika-sacrifice of Bādhari the brahmin appears as completely finished. Here is why: These ... brahmins, carakas, mendicants, ninety six kinds (of ones having left from home,)
delighted by the giving of alms, go away, each to their own country. || Haimavati (says:) Now, surely, the noble Maitreya (instructed) by the Śuddhāvāsa-gods, (after having left the brāhmin Bādhari,)

in order to leave from home for the Buddha he will come from Dakṣiṇāpatha to Madhyadeśa. || Pūrṇake says: "These divine kings also have come from afar following us. || (Sātagiri says: "Let us go, as the king Vaiśravana has ordered us to (go) readily
In order to leave his home for the Buddha he will come from Dakṣiṇāpatha to Madhyadeśa. (cf 23)
to the Pāṣānaka mountain for the sake of the (noble) Maitreya. Let us do that! The so noble Maitreya will come.
The so noble Maitreya will come. (23)

Haimavati (says: "Well) spoken. Let us go away!" All left. || The interlude has come to an end || Now this dialog should be understood (as taking place in) Dakṣiṇāpatha (in the house of Bādhari the brahmin.)

Thereupon, they come: [Bādhari,] surrounded (by his five hundred brahmin youths, with the noble Maitreya in the lead). With a bent body, Bādhari the brahmin, after having (touched) the hand of Maitreya, (he says: O noble Maitreya, I am full of joy),

o son, by the fact that (together with a glorious being) ... (being one hundred and twenty years old,) even with a worn body now, with a wish to obtain the excellent immortality, the realm of Brahmā, I have performed the saravāṣāṇḍika sacrifice.
Behold, son! || In the tune Etu: || These ninety six who have left from home, Brahmins, Carakas, Nagnas [and] Parivrājakas
